sub_title: Simply passionate about making a positive impact on the lives of others. One person at a time.
summary:
Before I begin…….

There are many excellent public speakers out there…..I prefer to be known as a public (and a personal….) great listener! After all, “Listening is Hearing with a Passion”. Doron Zilbershtein. 

As for a quick overview of who I am: 

1. I view my life purpose, and what makes my life meaningful, is to make a positive impact on the lives of others within my circle of influence. It includes family friends colleagues and students, to name a few examples. 
2. I was born happy and I spend my life seeking opportunities to stay happy. 
I am a passionate person in both, my personal and professional life. I live comfortably in challenging situations. Beware, my passion is contagious! 

2. My creative horizons are boundless; I hate Thinking Out of the Box because every box has only six dimensions! I always Think Out of the Sphere! 

3. I regard being “Ahead of the Curve” as a failure. I prefer to be the one who defines the curve for others to follow rather than one who follows a curve that has been defined by others. 

4. I enjoy and thrive on intellectual ping-pong and emotional acrobatics. 

5. I feel elated when I share my knowledge and experience through teaching with aspiring young adults.

profile_positions.title: Lecturer - Strategy and Entrepreneurship , Management Dep., School of Economics and Management

profile_positions.description: Develop syllabus, curriculum and exams for Master-level courses, including Hospitality, Operations Management, Entrepreneurship and Health Care for Dutch and international students.
profile_positions.title: Senior Lecturer
Lecturer Quality Management Organizational Excellence and Operations Management

profile_positions.description: I Chair dissertation and doctoral study committees, serve as University Research Reviewers (URR), serve as the second member of committees, participate in university and school based residencies and I teach various doctoral courses.
profile_positions.title: Contributing Faculty - DBA Program Walden University, The College of Management

profile_positions.description:
If you are looking to defeat mediocrity and bankrupt negative attitudes throughout your organization you reached the right profile. If you like to think out of the sphere, because out of the box is too square and boring for your appetite, and you feel comfortable sailing through the uncharted waters of excellence in your niche market, your are in for a treat!

In a nut shell, I have a passion for people and their performance in the business working environment and I love assisting small businesses who are eager to turn around their operation and achieve a sustainable excellence. I do so through a unique coaching approach that focuses on understanding and changing the way their team members THINK rather then focus on changing the way they BEHAVE.

Contact us at doronzil@gmail.com
profile_positions.title: Culture Explorer

company.name: DeVry University / Keller Graduate School of Management

profile_positions.description: Developed syllabus, curriculum, lesson plans, case studies, projects, quizzes, exams and other collaborative course material for MBA courses including: Project Management, Quality Management, Quality Culture, Leadership and Organizational Behavior, Change Management and Organizational Culture. Taught primarily in blended learning format, and through a hybrid class framework (students spend 35% of the course in class and 65% online with various assignments). Generated a high level of student satisfaction through the application of a unique approach to listening to students’ needs and gauging their individual academic pulse regularly with various means and methods.
profile_positions.title: Adj. Professor – Quality Management Organizational Behavior and Leadership

profile_positions.description:
• Acted as the Chief Operating Officer for the entire group of companies, in total, seven companies. 
• Develop SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Realistic, Timely manner) strategic objectives. 
• Lead the operations, marketing, supply chain, and legal aspects of the company.
• Created and led initiatives related to human capital improvement such as:
o The Development of a Succession Plan.
o Developed, conducted and analyzed a corporate climate survey.
o Developed a creative, all-inclusive rewards system for sales team.
o Developed organizational structure and job description for each position.
o Developed a corporate-wide transparent salary structure. 
• Responsible for Merger and Acquisition activities in foreign markets.
• Oversaw the development of branding campaign, including upgrades to the website.
• Oversaw development of sales and marketing strategic plan for each of the affiliated companies.
profile_positions.title: Chief Corporate Inspiration Officer (a.k.a. Chief Operating Officer – COO)

profile_positions.description:
• Applied three decades of experience and knowledge in the maritime industry to provide leadership and strategic direction to a naval architecture firm.
• Responsible for achieving strategic goals through a systematic approach and the cultivation of a quality culture. 
• Responsible for the development of human capital including succession plan, target education and personal growth, advanced internship program and a dynamic organizational structure. 
• Responsible for the business development following the Blue Ocean Strategy principles.
• Held two separate positions: Chief Visionary Officer and Leader of the Marine team. 

Acted as the Chief Strategist for the firm. Develop SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Realistic, Timely manner) strategic objectives.
profile_positions.title: Chief Visionary Officer

volunteer_experiences.description:
The BBIF Florida is a Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) and Community Development Enterprise (CDE) certified by the U.S. Department of the Treasury.  BBIF Florida is a is a non-traditional lender that specializes in providing loans to black, minority and underserved small businesses. BBIF Florida is a certified by the the U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) as a Community Advantage Lender.  The SBA’s Community Advantage program is designed to expand access to lower dollar loans and lending to small business owners in traditionally underserved communities by opening SBA’s 7(a) Loan Guaranty to community-based financial institutions like BBIF Florida.  BBIF Florida is also a member of the Opportunity Finance Network, a prestigious national membership group of CDFI’s. In addition to providing loan capital, the BBIF Florida assists its business clients in building their management capacity by offering Financial Technical Assistance training.

BBIF Florida began its operations in Orlando in 1987.   A major goal within the BBIF Florida Organizational Business Plan is to expand geographically and increase its capital, which will allow for BBIF Florida to expand its loan products and Financial Technical Assistance services to a larger number of target market and underserved clients statewide, thus increasing its impact on low and moderate-income workers and communities.  In October 2009, the organization began providing loans statewide in Florida.

See http://bbifflorida.com/

volunteer_experiences.role: Judge at the International Team Excellence Award
volunteer_experiences.description:
The International Team Excellence Award Process recognizes and celebrates high-performance teams that epitomize the ASQ vision of a global community using quality concepts, technology, and tools to improve themselves and their world.  

The preliminary round judging process starts with ASQ members completing an online application to serve as a preliminary round judge. The preliminary round process will be organized at several judging sites in the USA, judges will be required to complete pre-work, and travel to one of the judging sites is required. All judges will receive CEU and RU credits for their participation. See https://asq.org/programs/team-excellence
